fields.summary: Progress bars in Web UI always at 100%

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description: In our cluster setup, the YARN web UI always shows progress bars at 100% (see screenshot, progress of the reduce step is roughly at 32.82%). I opened the HTML source code to check (also see screenshot), and it seems the problem is that it uses a comma as decimal mark, where most browsers expect a dot for floating-point numbers. This could possibly be due to localized number formatting being used in the wrong place, which would also explain why this bug is not always visible.
fields.summary: Progress bars in Web UI always at 100% due to non-US locale

comments.body:
The progress bar doesn't show because of "String percent = String.format("%.1f", app.getProgress() * 100.0F);" in "org/apache/hadoop/yarn/server/webapp/AppsBlock.java" If the language is Italian, for example, the percent is a string with the comma, and so the output in HTML is: "
" if you change the comma this the dot it works.
Attaching a patch to use {{String.format(Locale.US, format, objects)}} instead of {{String.format(format, objects)}}. I grepped "%.1f" and "%.2f" in yarn source code and fixed them.

This message was automatically generated.
The test failures look unrelated to the patch.
Let me taking a look at this issue.
[~ajisakaa] how did you reproduce the problem? Could you share the configuration to reproduce it?
Execute {{export LANG=it_IT}} and restart ResourceManager.

[~ajisakaa] thanks for your help. I, however, cannot reproduce the bug by configuring export LC_ALL=it_IT and LANG=it_IT. Could you check whether this problem happens against current trunk? Or, please correct me if I have missing points.

One problem I found is the percentage of the app queue gets NaN - please check an attached file. Is this related issue?

Anyway, I agree with using StringFormat with locale. How about adding StringUtils.format()? It looks consistent fix with HADOOP-11602. We can add new tests against the new utility method.
Attaching my settings.

bq. How about adding StringUtils.format()? It looks consistent fix with HADOOP-11602. 
Good idea. I'll update the patch.

bq. One problem I found is the percentage of the app queue gets NaN - please check an attached file. Is this related issue?
[~ozawa], did you launch NodeManager? I see NaN when there's no NodeManager.
Yes, I launched NodeManager. yarn-site.xml looks same as mine overall. Are you running daemons on Linux? I'm trying on Mac OS.
I'm running them on Linux.
I'm running them on Linux.
I'm running them on Linux.
Sorry for duplicated comments :)

Attaching v4 patch
* Use {{StringUtils.format}} instead of {{String.format(Locale.ENGLISH, ...)}}.
* Removed yarn.util.StringHelper.percent and use StringUtils.formatPercent instead.
[~ajisakaa] maybe did you forget attaching the v4 patch?
[~ajisakaa] Could you attach the v4 patch, please ?
Thank you [~ozawa]. Attached v4 patch.
and thanks [~xgong] for pinging me.
